messages.content: You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Thermostat
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Range: 5.0 to 40.0
      Unit: °C
    Target Temperature
      Range: 10.0 to 30.0
      Unit: °C
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [1]
        Medium [2]
        High [3]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [SET_TEMP]
      Parameter 1: Temperature Value
        Range: 10.0 to 30.0
        Unit: °C
    Set Mode [SET_MODE]
      Parameter 1: Mode
        Enum: Off, Heat, Cool, Auto
    Set Fan Speed [SET_FAN]
      Parameter 1: Fan Speed
        Enum: Low, Medium, High
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Temperature [REPORT_TEMP]
    Report Mode [REPORT_MODE]

USER QUERY:
Can you set the thermostat to cool mode and target temperature to 22 degrees Celsius?

To address your request, I first identify the commands needed to change the mode and target temperature. The device accepts a Set Mode command with parameters Off, Heat, Cool, or Auto, and a Set Temperature command with a range from 10.0 to 30.0 °C.

You want to set the mode to Cool and the target temperature to 22 °C, which is within the allowed range.

Step 1: Use the Set Mode command with parameter 'Cool'.
Step 2: Use the Set Temperature command with parameter 22.0 °C.

Result: Execute SET_MODE with 'Cool' and SET_TEMP with 22.0 °C to configure the thermostat as requested.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Thermostat
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Range: 5.0 to 40.0
      Unit: °C
    Target Temperature
      Range: 10.0 to 30.0
      Unit: °C
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [1]
        Medium [2]
        High [3]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [SET_TEMP]
      Parameter 1: Temperature Value
        Range: 10.0 to 30.0
        Unit: °C
    Set Mode [SET_MODE]
      Parameter 1: Mode
        Enum: Off, Heat, Cool, Auto
    Set Fan Speed [SET_FAN]
      Parameter 1: Fan Speed
        Enum: Low, Medium, High
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Temperature [REPORT_TEMP]
    Report Mode [REPORT_MODE]

USER QUERY:
What fan speed options do I have and how can I set it to high?

Reviewing the device structure, the Fan Speed property is an enumerated type with three possible values: Low, Medium, and High.

To set the fan speed, the device accepts the Set Fan Speed command with a parameter that must be one of these three values.

Therefore, to set the fan speed to High, you would send the Set Fan Speed command with the parameter 'High'.

Result: Use the SET_FAN command with parameter 'High' to set the fan speed to high.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Thermostat
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Range: 5.0 to 40.0
      Unit: °C
    Target Temperature
      Range: 10.0 to 30.0
      Unit: °C
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [1]
        Medium [2]
        High [3]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [SET_TEMP]
      Parameter 1: Temperature Value
        Range: 10.0 to 30.0
        Unit: °C
    Set Mode [SET_MODE]
      Parameter 1: Mode
        Enum: Off, Heat, Cool, Auto
    Set Fan Speed [SET_FAN]
      Parameter 1: Fan Speed
        Enum: Low, Medium, High
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Temperature [REPORT_TEMP]
    Report Mode [REPORT_MODE]

USER QUERY:
Could you tell me the current temperature and mode of the thermostat?

The device has properties for Current Temperature (5.0 to 40.0 °C) and Mode (Off, Heat, Cool, Auto). To obtain these values, the device supports the Query Status command and also can send Report Temperature and Report Mode commands.

Step 1: Use the Query Status command to request the current state.
Step 2: The device will respond with the current temperature and mode.

Result: Send QUERY command to retrieve current temperature and mode from the thermostat.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Light
  ***Properties***
    Brightness
      Range: 0 to 100
      Unit: %
    Color
      Enum
        Red [1]
        Green [2]
        Blue [3]
        White [4]
        Warm White [5]
    Power State
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Brightness [SET_BRIGHTNESS]
      Parameter 1: Brightness Value
        Range: 0 to 100
        Unit: %
    Set Color [SET_COLOR]
      Parameter 1: Color
        Enum: Red, Green, Blue, White, Warm White
    Turn On [TURN_ON]
    Turn Off [TURN_OFF]
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Brightness [REPORT_BRIGHTNESS]
    Report Color [REPORT_COLOR]
    Report Power State [REPORT_POWER]

USER QUERY:
I want to set the living room light to 75% brightness and change the color to warm white. How do I do that?

The device properties include Brightness (0-100%) and Color (Red, Green, Blue, White, Warm White). The accepted commands to change these are Set Brightness and Set Color.

Step 1: Use the Set Brightness command with parameter 75 to set brightness to 75%.
Step 2: Use the Set Color command with parameter 'Warm White' to change the color.

Result: Send SET_BRIGHTNESS with 75% and SET_COLOR with 'Warm White' to configure the living room light as requested.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Light

    Brightness

        On [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Brightness [SET_BRIGHTNESS]
      Parameter 1: Brightness Value
        Range: 0 to 100
        Unit: %
    Set Color [SET_COLOR]
      Parameter 1: Color
        Enum: Red, Green, Blue, White, Warm White
    Turn On [TURN_ON]
    Turn Off [TURN_OFF]
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Brightness [REPORT_BRIGHTNESS]
    Report Color [REPORT_COLOR]
    Report Power State [REPORT_POWER]

USER QUERY:
Is the smart light currently on, and what is its brightness level?

The device has a Power State property with values Off and On, and a Brightness property ranging from 0 to 100%.

To find out if the light is on and its brightness, you can send the Query Status command or request the device to Report Power State and Report Brightness.

Step 1: Send QUERY command to get current status.
Step 2: The device will respond with Power State and Brightness values.

Result: Use QUERY to retrieve whether the light is on and its current brightness level.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Light
  ***Properties***
    Brightness
      Range: 0 to 100

    Color

        Range: 0 to 100

      Parameter 1: Color

    Turn Off [TURN_OFF]

    Report Brightness [REPORT_BRIGHTNESS]
    Report Color [REPORT_COLOR]
    Report Power State [REPORT_POWER]

USER QUERY:
Please turn off the smart light and set brightness to 0.

The device supports Turn Off and Set Brightness commands. Turning off the light sets the Power State to Off, and brightness can be set from 0 to 100%.

Step 1: Send the Turn Off command to switch the light off.
Step 2: Send the Set Brightness command with parameter 0 to set brightness to zero.

Result: Execute TURN_OFF command and SET_BRIGHTNESS with 0 to turn off the light and set brightness to zero.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Energy Meter
  ***Properties***
    Current Power Usage
      Range: 0 to 5000
      Unit: Watts
    Total Energy Consumed
      Range: 0 to 100000
      Unit: kWh
    Status
      Enum
        Normal [0]
        Warning [1]
        Error [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Reset Energy Counter [RESET_ENERGY]
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Power Usage [REPORT_POWER]
    Report Energy Consumed [REPORT_ENERGY]
    Report Status [REPORT_STATUS]

USER QUERY:
How can I check the current power usage and total energy consumed on the energy meter?

The device properties include Current Power Usage (0-5000 Watts) and Total Energy Consumed (0-100000 kWh). To retrieve these, the device accepts the Query Status command and can send Report Power Usage and Report Energy Consumed commands.

Step 1: Send the Query Status command to request current readings.
Step 2: The device will respond with current power usage in Watts and total energy consumed in kWh.

Result: Use QUERY command to obtain current power usage and total energy consumed from the energy meter.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Energy Meter
  ***Properties***
    Current Power Usage
      Range: 0 to 5000
      Unit: Watts
    Total Energy Consumed
      Range: 0 to 100000
      Unit: kWh
    Status
      Enum
        Normal [0]
        Warning [1]
        Error [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Reset Energy Counter [RESET_ENERGY]
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Power Usage [REPORT_POWER]
    Report Energy Consumed [REPORT_ENERGY]
    Report Status [REPORT_STATUS]

USER QUERY:
I want to reset the total energy consumed counter on the meter. How do I do that?

The device accepts a Reset Energy Counter command to reset the total energy consumed property.

Step 1: Confirm that resetting the energy counter is supported by the device.
Step 2: Send the RESET_ENERGY command to reset the total energy consumed value to zero.

Result: Execute RESET_ENERGY command to reset the total energy consumed counter on the energy meter.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Energy Meter
  ***Properties***
    Current Power Usage
      Range: 0 to 5000
      Unit: Watts
    Total Energy Consumed
      Range: 0 to 100000
      Unit: kWh
    Status
      Enum
        Normal [0]
        Warning [1]
        Error [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Reset Energy Counter [RESET_ENERGY]
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Power Usage [REPORT_POWER]
    Report Energy Consumed [REPORT_ENERGY]
    Report Status [REPORT_STATUS]

USER QUERY:
What does it mean if the energy meter status shows Warning?

The device's Status property is an enumerated value with three possible states: Normal [0], Warning [1], and Error [2].

A Warning status indicates that the device has detected a condition that may require attention but is not critical enough to be an error.

Step 1: Recognize that Warning is a cautionary state.
Step 2: Advise checking device logs or conditions that might cause warnings, such as unusual power usage or sensor issues.

Result: A Warning status means the energy meter has detected a potential issue that should be investigated but is not currently an error.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Door Lock
  ***Properties***
    Lock State
      Enum
        Locked [0]
        Unlocked [1]
    Battery Level
      Range: 0 to 100
      Unit: %
    Tamper Alert
      Enum
        No [0]
        Yes [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Lock Door [LOCK]
    Unlock Door [UNLOCK]
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Lock State [REPORT_LOCK]
    Report Battery Level [REPORT_BATTERY]
    Report Tamper Alert [REPORT_TAMPER]

USER QUERY:
Can you unlock the door and tell me the battery level?

The device accepts Unlock Door and Query Status commands. The Lock State property can be Locked or Unlocked, and Battery Level ranges from 0 to 100%.

Step 1: Send the Unlock Door command to unlock the door.
Step 2: Send the Query Status command or request Report Battery Level to get the current battery percentage.

Result: Execute UNLOCK command to unlock the door and QUERY or REPORT_BATTERY to retrieve the battery level.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Door Lock
  ***Properties***
    Lock State
      Enum
        Locked [0]
        Unlocked [1]
    Battery Level
      Range: 0 to 100
      Unit: %
    Tamper Alert
      Enum
        No [0]
        Yes [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Lock Door [LOCK]
    Unlock Door [UNLOCK]
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Lock State [REPORT_LOCK]
    Report Battery Level [REPORT_BATTERY]
    Report Tamper Alert [REPORT_TAMPER]

USER QUERY:
Is there any tamper alert on the door lock right now?

The Tamper Alert property is an enum with values No [0] and Yes [1]. To check this, you can send the Query Status command or request the Report Tamper Alert command.

Step 1: Send QUERY or REPORT_TAMPER command to the device.
Step 2: The device will respond with the current tamper alert status.

Result: Use QUERY or REPORT_TAMPER to determine if there is a tamper alert on the door lock.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Door Lock
  ***Properties***
    Lock State
      Enum
        Locked [0]
        Unlocked [1]
    Battery Level
      Range: 0 to 100
      Unit: %
    Tamper Alert
      Enum
        No [0]
        Yes [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Lock Door [LOCK]
    Unlock Door [UNLOCK]
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Lock State [REPORT_LOCK]
    Report Battery Level [REPORT_BATTERY]
    Report Tamper Alert [REPORT_TAMPER]

USER QUERY:
Please lock the door and then confirm it is locked.

The device accepts the Lock Door command to lock the door and can report the Lock State property.

Step 1: Send the LOCK command to lock the door.
Step 2: After locking, send QUERY or REPORT_LOCK command to confirm the door's lock state.
Step 3: Verify that the Lock State property returns Locked [0].

Result: Execute LOCK command followed by QUERY or REPORT_LOCK to confirm the door is locked.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Sprinkler Controller
  ***Properties***
    Zone Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Water Flow Rate
      Range: 0 to 50
      Unit: liters per minute
    Schedule Enabled
      Enum
        False [0]
        True [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Start Zone [START_ZONE]
      Parameter 1: Zone Number
        Range: 1 to 8
    Stop Zone [STOP_ZONE]
      Parameter 1: Zone Number
        Range: 1 to 8
    Enable Schedule [ENABLE_SCHEDULE]
    Disable Schedule [DISABLE_SCHEDULE]
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Zone Status [REPORT_ZONE]
    Report Water Flow [REPORT_FLOW]
    Report Schedule Status [REPORT_SCHEDULE]

USER QUERY:
Can you start watering zone 3 and enable the schedule?

The device accepts Start Zone command with a zone number parameter (1-8) and Enable Schedule command without parameters.

Step 1: Send START_ZONE command with parameter 3 to start watering zone 3.
Step 2: Send ENABLE_SCHEDULE command to enable the watering schedule.

Result: Execute START_ZONE(3) and ENABLE_SCHEDULE commands to start zone 3 watering and enable the schedule.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Sprinkler Controller
  ***Properties***
    Zone Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Water Flow Rate
      Range: 0 to 50
      Unit: liters per minute
    Schedule Enabled
      Enum
        False [0]
        True [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Start Zone [START_ZONE]
      Parameter 1: Zone Number
        Range: 1 to 8
    Stop Zone [STOP_ZONE]
      Parameter 1: Zone Number
        Range: 1 to 8
    Enable Schedule [ENABLE_SCHEDULE]
    Disable Schedule [DISABLE_SCHEDULE]
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Zone Status [REPORT_ZONE]
    Report Water Flow [REPORT_FLOW]
    Report Schedule Status [REPORT_SCHEDULE]

USER QUERY:
How do I stop watering zone 5 and check if the schedule is enabled?

The device accepts Stop Zone command with a zone number parameter (1-8) and can report the Schedule Enabled status.

Step 1: Send STOP_ZONE command with parameter 5 to stop watering zone 5.
Step 2: Send QUERY or REPORT_SCHEDULE command to check if the schedule is enabled (True or False).

Result: Execute STOP_ZONE(5) to stop watering zone 5 and QUERY or REPORT_SCHEDULE to verify schedule status.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Sprinkler Controller
  ***Properties***
    Zone Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Water Flow Rate

      Enum
        False [0]
        True [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Start Zone [START_ZONE]

        Range: 1 to 8
    Stop Zone [STOP_ZONE]
      Parameter 1: Zone Number
        Range: 1 to 8
    Enable Schedule [ENABLE_SCHEDULE]
    Disable Schedule [DISABLE_SCHEDULE]
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Zone Status [REPORT_ZONE]
    Report Water Flow [REPORT_FLOW]
    Report Schedule Status [REPORT_SCHEDULE]

USER QUERY:
What is the current water flow rate and which zones are active?

The device properties include Water Flow Rate (0-50 liters per minute) and Zone Status (Off or On for each zone).

To get this information, send the Query Status command or request Report Water Flow and Report Zone Status commands.

Step 1: Send QUERY command to retrieve current water flow rate and zone statuses.
Step 2: The device will respond with water flow in liters per minute and which zones are On or Off.

Result: Use QUERY to obtain current water flow rate and active zones from the sprinkler controller.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Sprinkler Controller
  ***Properties***
    Zone Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Water Flow Rate
      Range: 0 to 50
      Unit: liters per minute
    Schedule Enabled
      Enum
        False [0]
        True [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Start Zone [START_ZONE]
      Parameter 1: Zone Number
        Range: 1 to 8
    Stop Zone [STOP_ZONE]
      Parameter 1: Zone Number
        Range: 1 to 8
    Enable Schedule [ENABLE_SCHEDULE]
    Disable Schedule [DISABLE_SCHEDULE]
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Zone Status [REPORT_ZONE]
    Report Water Flow [REPORT_FLOW]
    Report Schedule Status [REPORT_SCHEDULE]

USER QUERY:
Can you disable the watering schedule and stop all zones?

The device accepts Disable Schedule command and Stop Zone command with zone number parameters.

Step 1: Send DISABLE_SCHEDULE command to disable the watering schedule.
Step 2: Since zones range from 1 to 8, send STOP_ZONE commands for each zone (1 through 8) to stop all watering zones.

Result: Execute DISABLE_SCHEDULE and STOP_ZONE(1) through STOP_ZONE(8) commands to disable schedule and stop all zones.
